title: Letter: Opting out is one solution to NHS records concerns
text:
Your leader (FT View, May 28) draws attention to the confidentiality issue around patient data that arises if and when such data, drawn from GPs, is merged under the auspices of the NHS.

However, the current lack of comprehensive digital patient records leads to worse care outcomes and massively bloated costs. Even now, what is being proposed has to do with data collected by GPs and will not necessarily include data generated at other NHS sites, particularly within hospitals. Truly comprehensive digital patient records are rarely available.

Yet the technology to make such data available — and end our reliance on paper records — has been around for over 30 years. See Bill Gates' 1995 book Business @ the Speed of Thought.

Although there are issues concerning the confidentiality of such records, “opting out” has become the accepted way to deal with this issue in other countries.

Peter Ford
London SW20, UK
